messageBody:
On Wed, 2004-03-10 at 21:28, haefeleuser wrote:
> Maybe some people here remember my discussion a year ago. I don't
> know what my nick name was. But my first topic was a discussion
> about the value of JUnit compared to Design by Contract.
>
> It was very controversial. At times I asked myself, if I was right
> when many gurus here were arguing against my opinion. I will not
> repeat the discussion.
>
> But I have seen that the DBC inventor himself seems to support my
> opinion recently: http://www.artima.com/intv/contestP.html
>
> I have only read the summary until now. Maybe you are interested in
> what he has to say in favor of Contract-Driven Development. I like
> the idea of Design by Contract. And I think that it could make
> traditional JUnit tests obsolete, since the test cases could
> automatically be generated from the Contracts. I think this is what
> Parasoft JTest already does.
>
> Don't misunderstand me. I like JUnit. But I always look for better
> ways to solve my problems. So I hope you are as open as me to new
> solutions and ideas.

I will say only this: if by any reason you find that DBC suits your
preferences/needs better than unit testing use it. But in trying to
convince a TDD person of it I believe you would be wasting your time. I
don't think, for instance, that DBC would have solved the recent issues
with the Mars rovers.

--
Jason Rogers
